Content:: This article documents the chronology and epidemiology of SARS-CoV-2 in August 2020, the virus which causes the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and is responsible for the COVID-19 pandemic. The first human cases of COVID-19 were identified in Wuhan, China, in December 2019. WHO Situation Report 194:[1] WHO Situation Report 195:[9] WHO Situation Report 196:[16] WHO Situation Report 197:[23] WHO Situation Report 198:[30] WHO Situation Report 199:[37] WHO Situation Report 200:[44] WHO Situation Report 201:[52] WHO Situation Report 202:[59] WHO Situation Report 203:[65] WHO Situation Report 204:[75] WHO Situation Report 205:[83] WHO Situation Report 206:[91] WHO Situation Report 207:[99] WHO Situation Report 208:[106] WHO Situation Report 209:[113] World Health Organization weekly report:[120] World Health Organization weekly report:[164] World Health Organization weekly report:[208] No new countries and territories confirmed their first cases during August 2020. By the end of August, only the following countries and territories have not reported any cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections: Africa Asia Europe Oceania
Title: Timeline of the COVID-19 pandemic in August 2020 - Wikipedia
